title: USM json schema definition
description: The detailed schema definition for the helm chart parameters of USM

pullSecret.description: Authorization token that stores docker credentials used for accessing a registry.

url.description: Image registry URL. Overrides global registry url if not empty.

imagePullPolicy.description: Image pull policy. One of Always, Never, IfNotPresent.

url.description: Image registry URL. Overrides global registry url if not empty.

imagePullPolicy.description: Image pull policy. One of Always, Never, IfNotPresent.

userAttributeHeader.description: User attribute header value used in rbac proxy headers.

dbProvider.description: Db provider name where UI settings data are stored.

dbsecretname.description: Secret name used for secure communication with DB.

housekeepingDays.description: Configuration for housekeeping of UI settings data in DB.

type.description: One of DB or Disk to provide flexibility of storage

provider.description: Provider where settings data are stored. DDPG if DB is configured as the type

host.description: The service host name in case DB is configured as the type

port.description: Port for connectivity in case DB is configured

dbName.description: Flexibility of exposing DB name configuration which is created in the Postgres

dbUser.description: DB username for connecting with the Postgres instance

size.description: The size of the allocated data volume, min size of volume claim is 3 Mi and max size is 1 Gi

storageClassName.description: Name of the data volume storageClass. When left empty, the default storageClass of the Kubernetes cluster will be used.

dbSecretName.description: Secret name used for secure communication if type is configured as DB

nameOverride.description: Override the name of the chart in chart.yaml.

localhostProfile.description: The localhostProfile should be provided if type is localhost

type.description: If the type is localhost then localhostProfile should be provided. Acceptable values are [unconfined, runtime/default, localhost, null]

localhostProfile.description: The localhostProfile should be provided if type is localhost

type.description: If the type is localhost then localhostProfile should be provided. Acceptable values are [unconfined, runtime/default, localhost, null]

fullnameOverride.description: Override the full name of resources.

type.description: If the type is localhost then localhostProfile should be provided. Acceptable values are [Unconfined, RuntimeDefault, Localhost, null].

localhostProfile.description: The localhostProfile should be provided if type is localhost.

type.description: If the type is localhost then localhostProfile should be provided. Acceptable values are [Unconfined, RuntimeDefault, Localhost, null].

localhostProfile.description: The localhostProfile should be provided if type is localhost.

replicaCount.description: Number of replicas. This value is currently under deprication, Changing this value is not recommended for singletons.

enabled.description: Option to switch between enable and disable of data collection
Provides flexibility to enable or disable system function control check for GUI Applications. Enabling this will control the availability of GUI applications based on function control status.

name.description: Name of the system function control service.

port.description: The port of system function control service.

issuer.description: CA certificate issuer for system function control service.
issuer.optionality: Conditional if global.security.tls.enabled is true and sfc.enabled is true

clientCertificateTtl.description: TTL value for the system function control client certificate.
clientCertificateTtl.optionality: Conditional if global.security.tls.enabled is true and sfc.enabled is true

labelName.description: Label name used for UI settings discovery.

maxUnavailable.description: Describes how many pods can be unavailable at a given time during the rolling update. This value is currently under deprication, Changing this value is not recommended for singletons.

maxSurge.description: Describes how many pods can be added at a time. This value is currently under deprication, Changing this value is not recommended for singletons.

scrape.description: Flag to determine if the scraping should be done.

nodeSelector.description: Configuration for node selection constraints, based on labels on the node.

usm.description: Configuration for node selection constraints, based on labels on the node for USM deployment

usm-hk.description: Configuration for node selection constraints, based on labels on the node for USM for cronjob

topologySpreadConstraints.description: Configuration for topology-spread constraints.  This value is currently under deprication, Changing this value is not recommended for singletons.

name.description: Parameter denotes the GUI aggregator service name based on which client CA resource name is looked up during deployment and trusted in UI settings manager service for mTLS UI handshake

streamingMethod.description: Default value is empty, meaning that the global.log.streamingMethod value is used.  If the global parameter is also null or empty, indirect streaming is chosen.

clientCertificateTtl.description: Indicates TTL of client certificate created for log transformer streaming. Default is empty, meaning that SIP-TLS validity value is used.

issuer.description: Indicates issuer based on which client certificate is created

queueSize.description: Indicates internal queue size used for storing log events

connectionTtlSeconds.description: Indicates socket connection TTL value (in seconds)

enabled.description: Pod-level firewall. If enabled, pod can only be accessed via Ingress.

autoScaling.description: Allows to dynamically scale number of replicas without intervention based on a criteria. This value is currently under deprication, Changing this value is not recommended for singletons.

enabled.description: Flag that determines if autoScaling should be enabled/disabled.

targetCPUUtilizationPercentage.description: If the mean of the pod's CPU utilization is higher than the target defined, the replicas will be adjusted.

enabled.description: Indicates flag to enable or disable CM mediator dependency in USM

clientCertificateTtl.description: Indicates TTL value of client certificate created for CM mediator communication.

issuer.description: Indicates issuer based on which client certificate is created for CM mediator.

enabled.description: Flexibility to enable/disable the deployment of ingress resource.

ca.description: CA to verify incoming requests from ingress, mandatory if ingress has been installed with clientCertificate.enabled=true

ingressClass.description: Ingress class name indicates which ingress controller instance will consume the ingress resource.

service.description: The calls will be routed to this configured RBAC proxy from ingress.

port.description: The port of configured RBAC proxy service.

tolerations.description: Configuration for scheduling based on taints on the nodes.

oneOf.description: Configuration for scheduling based on taints on the nodes.
Configuration for scheduling based on taints on the nodes.

usm.description: Configuration for scheduling based on taints on the nodes for USM deployment

usm-hk.description: Configuration for scheduling based on taints on the nodes for USM cronjob

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Maximum graceful termination timeout in seconds.

oneOf.description: Maximum graceful termination timeout in seconds.

usm.description: Maximum graceful termination timeout in seconds for usm deployments

usm-hk.description: Maximum graceful termination timeout in seconds for usm cronjobs

labels.description: Custom labels added to all chart resources.

annotations.description: Custom annotations added to all chart resources.

podAntiAffinity.description: Anti-affinity config. The value hard will require one node per replica, while soft is best-effort anti-affinity. This value is currently under deprication, Changing this value is not recommended for singletons.

topologyKey.description: TopologyKey is the key of a label attached to a node. If two Nodes are labelled with this key and have identical values for that label, the scheduler treats both Nodes as being in the same topology. The scheduler tries to place a balanced number of Pods into each topology domain

nodeAffinity.description: Configuration to constrain the nodes the pods are eligible to be scheduled on, based on labels on the node.

anyOf.description: Configuration to constrain the nodes the pods are eligible to be scheduled on, based on labels on the node.

usm.description: Configuration to constrain the nodes the pods are eligible to be scheduled on, based on labels on the node.

usm-hk.description: Configuration to constrain the nodes the pods are eligible to be scheduled on, based on labels on the node.

podDisruptionBudget.description: Specifies the number/percentage of Pods that must remain available during voluntary disruptions. Either minAvailable or maxUnavailable shall be configured and not both. This value is currently under deprication, Changing this value is not recommended for singletons.

minAvailable.description: Number of pods from the set that must still be available after the eviction, even in the absence of the evicted pod.

maxUnavailable.description: Number of pods from the set that can be unavailable after the eviction.

memory.description: Memory resource request for the container.

cpu.description: CPU resource request for the container.

ephemeral-storage.description: Ephemeral storage resource request for the container.

memory.description: Memory resource limit for the container. The container will be killed with an out of memory error if it goes above this limit.

cpu.description: CPU resource limit for the container. The container CPU usage may be throttled to this value.

ephemeral-storage.description: Ephemeral storage resource request for the container. The container will be killed with an out of memory error if it goes above this limit.

memory.description: Memory resource request for the cronjob.

cpu.description: CPU resource request for the cronjob.

ephemeral-storage.description: Ephemeral storage resource request for the cronjob.

memory.description: Memory resource limit for the cronjob. The job will be killed with an out of memory error if it goes above this limit.

cpu.description: CPU resource limit for the cronjob. The job CPU usage may be throttled to this value.

ephemeral-storage.description: Ephemeral storage resource request for the cronjob. The job will be killed with an out of memory error if it goes above this limit.

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded.

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before the probes are initiated.

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe.

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out.

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded.

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before the probes are initiated.

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe.

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed.

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out.
